Description: Body sherd of Chian Simple Animal Style pottery chalice; white slip; interior glazed streaky black with traces of three added white bands; exterior: painted decoration consisting of part of tail of lion or sphinx; part of complex rosette as filling ornament.
Curator's comments: for parallels regarding the decoration, see British Museum 1965,0930.321.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GD.0895) (phase 2)
